definition: to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Go see it-I guarantee it'll knock your socks off!
sentences.chinese: 你得去看看，保证会让你激动万分的。

sentences.english: They all stopped working and were talking excitedly.
sentences.chinese: 他们都停下手中的活儿，激动地交谈起来。

sentences.english: But now it seems Indians, too, are getting less worked up about dalliances.
sentences.chinese: 如今似乎印度人也对放荡不那么激动了。

sentences.english: Unique combination of real time strategy with turn-based strategy, wonderful graphic, exciting gameplay allow you to feel yourself a real world ruler.
sentences.chinese: 令人激动的游戏让你认为自己是一个现实世界统治者。

sentences.english: He said he is less thrilled that Mr. Killinger remains in command.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，对基林格继续执掌大权的并不感到激动。

sentences.english: But she kept calm amid all these excitements.
sentences.chinese: 但她在所有激动面前保持镇静。

sentences.english: The old-time thrill at receiving a publisher's check was gone.
sentences.chinese: 以前那种发表作品收到支票时的激动已经没有了。

sentences.english: The idea that she will go abroad for further study made herself excited.
sentences.chinese: 她一想到就要出国深造，激动不已。

sentences.english: That he will come to the conference has excited every one of us.
sentences.chinese: 他要来参加会议使我们每一个人都十分激动。

sentences.english: When the film became very exciting, Tom and Sally would hold their breath.
sentences.chinese: 电影演到激动人心处时，汤姆和萨莉就会屏住呼吸。

sentences.english: Rafting can be exciting, but on the other hand, it can be dangerous sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 乘筏漂流令人激动，但另一方面它有时也是危险的。

sentences.english: I got carried away and started shouting at the television.
sentences.chinese: 我激动得不能自持，冲着电视机大叫起来。

sentences.english: Her delicate face flushed pink, her lips pouted softly, as if she were going to cry.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸激动的发红，轻轻地撅着嘴，仿佛要哭似的。

sentences.english: Analysis of the retrograde sequence of AP activation may localize and ablate the APs successfully.
sentences.chinese: 仔细分析旁路逆传激动顺序可以精确定位，成功消蚀。

sentences.english: Your father takes on too much. He forgets he's not growing any younger.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲太易激动，他忘记自己上了年纪。

sentences.english: Satan rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 撒但起来攻击以色列人，激动大卫数点他们。

definition: happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
to exhibit one's feelings in one's speech
to be unable to hold back
